paragraphs.content: Nothing in this Agreement shall obligate any Party to disclose any particular Confidential Information.

All Confidential Information disclosed by a Party shall remain the sole and exclusive property of that Party as the Disclosing Party. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as granting the Receiving Party any right, title, ownership, interest, license, or other rights in or to such Confidential Information, including any intellectual property rights of the Disclosing Party, whether by license, implication, or otherwise. For the avoidance of doubt, disclosure of Confidential Information shall not result in any joint ownership of such information among the Parties.

The Receiving Party shall have no rights to use or exploit the Confidential Information disclosed by the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted under this Agreement and solely for the Permitted Purpose.
